thread.title: Five Manchester United players who must convince Jose Mourinho
thread.title_full: Five Manchester United players who must convince Jose Mourinho

author: men
title: Five Manchester United players who must convince Jose Mourinho
text:
Five Manchester United players who must convince Jose Mourinho A number of Man Utd players are, for different reasons, battling to impress the Old Trafford manager. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jose Mourinho has a dig at Jurgen Klopp Share this video Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Morgan Schneiderlin and Memphis Depay may have left Old Trafford in January, but other Manchester United players’ futures are far from certain. 
Jose Mourinho ’s side, outside the top four after three successive Premier League draws ahead of Sunday's visit to Leicester, are not at the level the manager wants yet. 
And with Antoine Griezmann expected to arrive in Manchester this summer, some players could be in their final months at the club. 
Here are five who have a point to prove to Mourinho in the last three months of the season: Anthony Martial 
United were goaded over the £36million they paid for the Monaco forward in 2015 with add-ons potentially making the final fee almost £60m. 
He silenced the sceptics in his first year in the Premier League, becoming one of few positives from Louis van Gaal’s stint at the club. 
But the Frenchman appears to be suffering from second-season syndrome, having scored just twice all year in the league and getting on the wrong side of his manager. He's been warned to get his head down and make himself undroppable by the manager, something he hasn't managed to do yet. Anthony Martial. Wayne Rooney 
Rooney divides United fan opinion like no other player with as many deeming the 31-year-old a liability as those who back him as a club legend. 
He took the all-time goal scoring record with a moment of magic at Stoke City last month but that was just his second league goal of the season. 
Talk of a move to China of MLS remains stubbornly frequent and even the most avid Rooney fan would admit he is not the player he used to be. Luke Shaw 
Mourinho had already criticised the left-back when he was Chelsea manager, opting not to pursue their interest in the then Southampton man due to his wage demands. 
The relationship has not become any warmer since the Portuguese’s arrival at Old Trafford, with his fitness, injury record and form raising questions. Luke Shaw. 
Shaw shone during Van Gaal’s time at United before a horrific double leg-break. The left-back slot that seemed his to keep for years is now up for grabs. Chris Smalling 
Like fellow England defender Shaw, Smalling impressed during Van Gaal’s torrid time in Manchester. 
He was arguably England’s best centre-back last season and with summer signing Eric Bailly was expected to form a first-choice partnership. 
Injury then the form of Marcus Rojo and Phil Jones put paid to that. Jones' absence for the clash with Leicester this weekend could present him with an opportunity. Tim Fosu-Mensah. Timothy Fosu-Mensah 
The young defender - who can play at right-back or centre-back - is caught in the middle ground between the under-23s and the first team. 
His chance in the starting X1 against Wigan last week was met by relief and excitement in equal measure. 
He has featured seven times this season - largely in the cups - but the versatile 19-year-old clearly still has some work to convince Mourinho to rely on him more regualrly. Read More
